intro: Hedyosmum llanorum, commonly known as the Llanos hedyosmum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly the Llanos region of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit, simple opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, adapting to the humid and often waterlogged conditions of its native habitat. Hedyosmum llanorum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
